Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 218, \u00a7\u00a7 19.proposition: Jurisdiction and venue are proper in the Cambridge District Court pursuant to Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 218, §§ 19 and 27 and Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 239 (summary process and district court jurisdiction over landlord-tenant matters), because the Premises are located in Cambridge, Middlesex County, and the amount claimed is within the jurisdictional limits of this court.

Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 239.proposition: Jurisdiction and venue are proper in the Cambridge District Court pursuant to Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 218, §§ 19 and 27 and Mass. Gen. Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186.proposition: See generally Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186; Restatement (Second) of Property § 16.4 (implied covenant of quiet enjoyment); and Massachusetts case law recognizing and enforcing the covenant of quiet enjoyment in the landlord-tenant context.
